Supreme Court lets Trump administration cut $783 million of research funding in anti-DEI push
subhead: The order marks the latest Supreme Court win for Trump and allows the administration to forge ahead with canceling hundreds of grants while the lawsuit continues to unfold.

title: August heat wave deemed a 'rare event' by Météo-France
subhead: The recent heat wave ranks among the most severe ever experienced in the south of France, rivaling the historic August 2003 event, according to the French weather forecasting adminstration. It was also the second-longest recorded in August.

title: Violence against women: 'France would benefit from implementing a unified policy under a specialized prosecutor's office'
subhead: In France, national prosecutors for financial crime and anti-terrorism have proven effective. Gender-based violence warrants the same level of action and coordination, writes Vanessa Bousardo, vice president of the Paris Bar Association.

title: 'Marthe Robin was attacked all her life': Catholic mystic's hometown faces disputes over legacy
subhead: 'Marthe Robin, Saint Or Fraud?' (4/5). Accusations of deception against the Catholic mystic continue to cast a shadow – and even divide – inhabitants of her village.

title: In the Donbas, a Ukrainian high schooler's rebellion against Russification
subhead: At her Russian-controlled high school near Luhansk, a pro-Ukrainian teenager who resisted propaganda was the target of relentless disciplinary action since January. Fearing that she could be placed in foster care or even adopted, her mother decided to flee the occupied territory.

title: France faces prospect of paying higher borrowing costs than Italy
subhead: Rome has significantly reduced its public deficit over the past three years, while Paris has allowed its own to spiral. In the eyes of investors, Italy is now as credible as France, despite a heavier debt burden. On the markets, the gap in interest rates between the two countries has nearly vanished.
byline: By Denis Cosnard and Allan Kaval (Rome (Italy) correspondent)

title: What is Kick, the platform on which a French streamer died live?
subhead: Raphaël Grave, known online as Jean Pormanove, died Monday during a livestream. The tragedy has shed light on a little-known streaming site and its extremely permissive moderation policies.
byline: By Damien Leloup and Olivier Clairouin
